answers.answer: Not true. Cataracts are taken off when they are causing a big problem for the person that have them. Relatively small cataracts are often removed from people that work as truckdrivers, pilots, surgeons and others that need good vision to make a living.Rick factors for young cataracts: smoking, heavy drinking, obesity, diabetes, drugs like steroids, injury to the eye, positive family history.JCH MD

title: Recently diagnosed with cataracts
